item.title: Mastering Iterators in Python: Understanding the Iterable and Iterator Protocols
item.description: Introduction to Iterators in Python. An iterator is an object in Python that represents a sequence of values. It is used to iterate over a container, such as a list, tuple, or dictionary. The iterator provides a way to access each item in the container one at a time, without having to know the details of how the container is implemented. Here’s an example of creating an iterator in Python:
